text:
Created attachment 26506
Files to reproduce issue

We're running Apache 2.2.17 compiled against OpenSSL 0.9.8q with the FIPS 1.2 module, we're using PHP 5.3.5. Our platform is Redhat ES5.

When we introduce the SSLFIPS directive in our httpd.conf and log in to our application (which requires a license) the license files to decrypt via PHP. However, without the SSLFIPS directive, everything works fine. We've been digging through this and trying to figure out what's going on, it appears to be something FIPS enabled. I've attached a tarball containing instructions, PHP scripts, and keys to reproduce this issue.

If you need further information, feel free to ask.
creator: jyerge@tenable.com

text:
Take this up with your application vendor, their license check uses some
FIPS-prohibited ciphers or hash.  This is not a support forum, it's a tracker
for flaws in the software.  Peer-to-peer user support should always be
directed to the users list.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: We are the application vendor and we've attempted to create the pub/priv keys in FIPS mode and are still encountering this issue.
creator: jyerge@tenable.com
wrowe@apache.org
text:
Please review http://openssl.org/docs/fips/ - it is incumbent upon you to
thoroughly understand openssl's FIPS operating mode if you are attempting
to set this in conjunction with your software - what is and what is not
FIPS validated.  This remains your issue, with the openssl library, and
has nothing whatsoever to do with Apache software.

SSLFIPS On does exactly what it says, it changes the operating mode of
the openssl library, and the impact of that is for you to understand and
compensate for.  Or else don't enable it.
